title: Rock-Paper-Scissors API Documentation
content:
Introduction#Welcome to the documentation for the Rock-Paper-Scissors game API. This API allows you to play against the computer and track the score.
How to Play#Use the /play endpoint to play a round. Check the /score endpoint to see the current score. If you wish to restart the game, send a request to the /restart endpoint. Enjoy the game!
Endpoints#POST /play#Play a round of Rock-Paper-Scissors.
Request Body:
{ "choice": "rock" // string (one of "rock", "paper", "scissors") } Response:
user_choice (string): The choice you made. api_choice (string): The choice made by the computer. result (string): The result of the round, e.g., “You win!” GET /score#Retrieve the current score of the game.
Response:
user (int): Number of rounds you’ve won. api (int): Number of rounds the computer has won. draws (int): Number of rounds that ended in a draw. PUT /restart#Restart the game, setting all scores back to zero.
Response:
message (string): A confirmation message that the game has been reset. score (object): The current (now reset) score. Note#If the server restarts, all scores will be reset to 0.
Source Code#Rock-Paper-Scissors GitHub Repository
